segment.source: Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods
segment.target: Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods

segment.source: Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods
segment.target: Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods

segment.source: Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods
segment.target: Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) configurations determine how settings are synchronized throughout the enterprise.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) configurations determine how settings are synchronized throughout the enterprise.

segment.source: This topic describes how UE-V configurations are created to help you formulate a configuration plan that best meets your business requirements.
segment.target: This topic describes how UE-V configurations are created to help you formulate a configuration plan that best meets your business requirements.

segment.source: Configuration methods for UE-V
segment.target: Configuration methods for UE-V

segment.source: You can configure UE-V before, during, or after agent installation, depending on the configuration method that you use.
segment.target: You can configure UE-V before, during, or after agent installation, depending on the configuration method that you use.

segment.source: Group Policy: existing Group Policy infrastructure can be used to configure UE-V before or after UE-V Agent deployment.
segment.target: Group Policy: existing Group Policy infrastructure can be used to configure UE-V before or after UE-V Agent deployment.

segment.source: The UE-V ADMX template enables the central management of common UE-V Agent configuration options, and it includes settings to configure UE-V synchronization.
segment.target: The UE-V ADMX template enables the central management of common UE-V Agent configuration options, and it includes settings to configure UE-V synchronization.

segment.source: Network environments that use Group Policy can preconfigure UE-V in anticipation of agent deployment.
segment.target: Network environments that use Group Policy can preconfigure UE-V in anticipation of agent deployment.

segment.source: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects

segment.source: Installing the UE-V Group Policy ADMX Templates
segment.target: Installing the UE-V Group Policy ADMX Templates

segment.source: Command-line or Batch Script Installation: parameters that are used with the deployment of the UE-V Agent allow the configuration of many UE-V settings.
segment.target: Command-line or Batch Script Installation: parameters that are used with the deployment of the UE-V Agent allow the configuration of many UE-V settings.

segment.source: Electronic software distribution systems, such as System Center Configuration Manager, use these parameters to configure their clients when deploying and installing the UE-V Agent software.
segment.target: Electronic software distribution systems, such as System Center Configuration Manager, use these parameters to configure their clients when deploying and installing the UE-V Agent software.

segment.source: For a list of installation parameters and sample installation scripts, see Deploying the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: For a list of installation parameters and sample installation scripts, see Deploying the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: PowerShell and WMI: scripted commands using PowerShell or WMI can be used to modify configurations after the UE-V Agent has been installed.
segment.target: PowerShell and WMI: scripted commands using PowerShell or WMI can be used to modify configurations after the UE-V Agent has been installed.

segment.source: For a list of PowerShell and WMI commands, see Managing the UE-V 1.0 Agent and Packages with PowerShell and WMI.
segment.target: For a list of PowerShell and WMI commands, see Managing the UE-V 1.0 Agent and Packages with PowerShell and WMI.

segment.source: Edit Registry Settings: UE-V settings are stored in the registry and can be modified by using any tool that can modify registry settings, such as RegEdit.
segment.target: Edit Registry Settings: UE-V settings are stored in the registry and can be modified by using any tool that can modify registry settings, such as RegEdit.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Registry modification can result in data loss or the computer becoming unresponsive.
segment.target: Registry modification can result in data loss or the computer becoming unresponsive.

segment.source: We recommend that you use other configuration methods.
segment.target: We recommend that you use other configuration methods.

segment.source: UE-V configuration settings
segment.target: UE-V configuration settings

segment.source: The following are examples of UE-V configuration settings:
segment.target: The following are examples of UE-V configuration settings:

segment.source: Setting Storage Path: specifies the location of the file share that stores the UE-V settings.
segment.target: Setting Storage Path: specifies the location of the file share that stores the UE-V settings.

segment.source: Settings Template Catalog Path: specifies the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.
segment.target: Settings Template Catalog Path: specifies the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.

segment.source: Register Microsoft Templates: specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.
segment.target: Register Microsoft Templates: specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.

segment.source: Synchronization Method: specifies whether the Windows Offline Files feature is used for offline support.
segment.target: Synchronization Method: specifies whether the Windows Offline Files feature is used for offline support.

segment.source: Synchronization Timeout: specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before timeout when retrieving the user settings from the settings storage location.
segment.target: Synchronization Timeout: specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before timeout when retrieving the user settings from the settings storage location.

segment.source: Synchronization Enable: specifies whether the UE-V settings synchronization is enabled or disabled.
segment.target: Synchronization Enable: specifies whether the UE-V settings synchronization is enabled or disabled.

segment.source: Maximum Package Size: specifies a settings package file threshold size in bytes at which the UE-V Agent reports a warning.
segment.target: Maximum Package Size: specifies a settings package file threshold size in bytes at which the UE-V Agent reports a warning.
